page.title: 05POLITICS IN ISLINGTON
page.content: Islington's politics are certainly lively.In the 1983 election the seats could have gone either way,but in the end Jeremy Corbyn (Labour) beat off the Tories and Alliance to take Islington North comfortably.In Islington South it was a completely different story where Chris Smith (Labour) just got in by 500 odd votes.The S.D.P came second,just following a campaign by former Labour M.P John Cunningham.There have been no major incidents since that election involving our two local M.P's except that Corbyn has visited Nicaregua and has publicly supported the visit to London of Sinn Fein representatives. Surprisingly Islington's politics are better known for the council and it's work. The council have been victim of a campaign by the local paper,the Islington Gazette,and in some of the
